body:
I've only see this when two friends are clicking the call button in qTox as fast as they can at the same time, which translates to both friends calling `toxav_call` and `toxav_call_control` in rapid succession.

The full backtrace:
```
#0  friend_not_valid (m=0x555556965000, friendnumber=2) at ../toxcore/Messenger.c:50                                                                                                                       
#1  0x00007ffff62b7402 in write_cryptpacket_id (m=0x555556965000, friendnumber=2, packet_id=69 'E', data=0x7fffffffc870 "\001\001\002", length=4, congestion_control=0 '\000')
    at ../toxcore/Messenger.c:968
#2  0x00007ffff62b9030 in m_msi_packet (m=0x555556965000, friendnumber=2, data=0x7fffffffc870 "\001\001\002", length=4) at ../toxcore/Messenger.c:1803
#3  0x00007ffff62ced5e in send_message (m=0x555556965000, friend_number=2, msg=0x7fffffffc9b0) at ../toxav/msi.c:467
#4  0x00007ffff62ce303 in msi_hangup (call=0x555556965010) at ../toxav/msi.c:241
#5  0x00007ffff62d36e9 in toxav_call_control (av=0x5555568a1150, friend_number=2, control=TOXAV_CALL_CONTROL_CANCEL, error=0x0) at ../toxav/toxav.c:471
```

In frame 0 the friendlist is:
```
(gdb) p m
$12 = (const Messenger *) 0x555556965000
(gdb) p m->friendlist
$13 = (Friend *) 0x18
```

I don't think qTox is corrupting the tox struct because it looks like we're properly mutex protecting its access.

The issue is easily reproducible in about 10s of spam clicking on both sides. It seems like about half the time both friends crash and half only one of them crashes.

I wasn't able to reproduce it switching windows between two profiles locally, so if someone needs help reproing let me know.

comment_data.body:
@anthonybilinski its the known crash in friend_not_valid() reported a long time ago.
can you please try to compile qTox with:
https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/1431
and see if the bug still persists?
#1431 will be merged as soon as its review is complete.

I still hit a segfault using #1431 but with a different backtrace:
```
(gdb) bt                                                                                                                                                                                                   
#0  __GI___pthread_mutex_trylock (mutex=0x3200000043) at ../nptl/pthread_mutex_trylock.c:42                                                                                                                
#1  0x00007ffff62c9dbf in msi_hangup (call=0x5555579b64f0) at ../toxav/msi.c:257
#2  0x00007ffff62d0464 in toxav_call_control (av=0x555556737800, friend_number=2, control=TOXAV_CALL_CONTROL_CANCEL, error=0x0) at ../toxav/toxav.c:554
```
@anthonybilinski can u also upload the stacktrace of the other threads please?
also does qTox lock ToxAV api calls against each other? ToxAV is not thread safe

Still using #1431, no other threads are in toxcore, but one thread that has something to do with audio in qTox:

there's another bunch of threads waiting in Qt, but none seem at all relevant.

Yes qTox locks all accesses, which is why Thread 25 is currently waiting before calling `toxav_audio_send_frame`.

> I still hit a segfault using #1431 but with a different backtrace:
> 
> ```
> (gdb) bt                                                                                                                                                                                                   
> #0  __GI___pthread_mutex_trylock (mutex=0x3200000043) at ../nptl/pthread_mutex_trylock.c:42                                                                                                                
> #1  0x00007ffff62c9dbf in msi_hangup (call=0x5555579b64f0) at ../toxav/msi.c:257
> #2  0x00007ffff62d0464 in toxav_call_control (av=0x555556737800, friend_number=2, control=TOXAV_CALL_CONTROL_CANCEL, error=0x0) at ../toxav/toxav.c:554
> ```

why does it crash at https://github.com/zoff99/c-toxcore/blob/zoff99/toxav_public_api_part_009_big_change/toxav/msi.c#L257
?
call and mutex seem to be valid.

could be a lurking issue in ToxAV, there are many of those.
maybe as a workaround don't allow "calling toxav_call and toxav_call_control in rapid succession"

`session` is invalid in that context:
```
(gdb) frame
#1  0x00007ffff62c9dbf in msi_hangup (call=0x5555579b64f0) at ../toxav/msi.c:257
257         if (pthread_mutex_trylock(session->mutex) != 0) {
(gdb) p *session
Cannot access memory at address 0x3200000023
```
so the lock just causes the crash because it's dereferencing the already invalid variable.

Yes, this bug still happens.

For me, the circumstances are similar: A friend call you multiple times and you reject a call twice, then qTox crashes.

@n4skx does this only happen with qTox (which is archived on github https://github.com/qTox/qTox) or also with qTox_enhanced (https://github.com/Zoxcore/qTox_enhanced) ?
both qtox versions have some issues and should be used only with caution.
I did not tested with qTox_enhanced, i will test tomorrow

title: Segfault from toxav_call_control with invalid Messenger friendlist
